text: Welcome to Danish Lesson One. In this lesson you'll learn essential Danish greetings and introductions.
Let's begin with the most common way to say hello in Danish.

Now let's practice several different dialogue variations. First listen to this exchange:

Let's practice some more natural conversation variations. Here's another dialogue:

Now let's practice some real-world situations. First imagine you're meeting someone at a café in Copenhagen:
You'll play both roles. First person A then person B. Listen first:
Tak. Jeg hedder Peter. Hvordan har du det
Jeg har det godt tak. Og dig
Now you try. First you're asking to sit down then respond as Marie. Start with Hej
Next imagine you're meeting a new Danish colleague at work:
Ja jeg er ny. Jeg hedder Anders
Velkommen Anders. Jeg hedder Sofia. Hvordan har du det
Jeg har det godt tak. Det er rart at møde dig
Try this dialogue. First as the new colleague then as Sofia. Begin with Hej
Finally let's practice meeting someone at a language learning meetup:
Ja det gør jeg. Jeg hedder Emma
Jeg hedder Thomas. Hvordan har du det med dansk
Det er svært men jeg har det godt med det. Tak for snakken
Practice this exchange playing both roles. Try to make it natural.
Let's practice each part of these conversations separately. First let's do the café scene slowly and carefully. Listen to the first role:

Practice asking about someone's experience with Danish
Let's try one more variation of this scene:

This concludes lesson one. You can now introduce yourself greet others and have a basic conversation in Danish. Well done!
This concludes lesson one. You've learned how to greet someone introduce yourself ask and answer basic questions and say goodbye. You can now have a basic Danish conversation!
Practice these phrases and dialogues until they feel natural. We'll build on them in the next lesson.
